Dimapur.title: Dimapur, Nagaland
info: Serves as the main commercial and economic hub of Nagaland.
It is the most populous and largest city in the state.
Home to the only airport and railway station in Nagaland, making it the primary gateway to the state.
Known for the ancient Dimasa Kachari Ruins, which include a series of mushroom-domed pillars.
The district has a diverse population from all over Nagaland and other parts of India.

Kohima.title: Kohima, Nagaland
info: The capital city of Nagaland.
Known for the historic Battle of Kohima during World War II, a crucial turning point in the war.
The Kohima War Cemetery honors the soldiers who lost their lives in the battle.
Hosts the famous Hornbill Festival at the Naga Heritage Village, Kisama.
Inhabited predominantly by the Angami and Rengma Naga tribes.

Mokokchung.title: Mokokchung, Nagaland
info: Considered the cultural and intellectual capital of Nagaland.
The district is predominantly inhabited by the Ao Naga tribe.
Mokokchung town is a major urban center in the state.
Villages like Mopungchuket and Longkhum are famous for their Ao legends and scenic beauty.
Christmas and New Year celebrations in Mokokchung town are renowned throughout the state.

Mon.title: Mon, Nagaland
info: Known as the 'Land of the Anghs', the hereditary chiefs of the Konyak Naga tribe.
The Konyak tribe is famous for its history of headhunting, intricate facial tattoos, and traditional craftsmanship.
Longwa village is unique as the international border with Myanmar runs through the Angh's house.
The Aoleang festival, celebrated in April, is the biggest festival of the Konyak.
The district offers a deep insight into the traditional Naga way of life.

Phek.title: Phek, Nagaland
info: The district headquarters is Phek town.
Inhabited by the Chakhesang and Pochury Naga tribes.
Known for its rich biodiversity and the scenic Pf√ºtsero town, the highest and coldest town in Nagaland.
The district is famous for its legendary wrestling techniques.
Shilloi Lake is the largest natural lake in Nagaland and a place of many legends.

Tuensang.title: Tuensang, Nagaland
info: One of the largest districts of Nagaland, bordering Myanmar.
Inhabited by multiple tribes, primarily the Chang, Yimkhiung, Khiamniungan, and Sangtam.
The district headquarters is Tuensang town.
Known for its vibrant tribal culture, handicrafts, and handlooms.
Longtrok (six stones) at Chungliyimti village is a significant historical and mythological site.

Wokha.title: Wokha, Nagaland
info: Known as the 'Land of Plenty'.
Predominantly inhabited by the Lotha Naga tribe.
The district headquarters is Wokha town.
Famous for the Doyang Hydro Project and its reservoir, which is a roosting site for Amur Falcons.
Mount Tiyi is a legendary peak believed to be the abode of departed souls.

Zunheboto.title: Zunheboto, Nagaland
info: Considered the homeland of the Sumi Naga tribe.
The Sumi are known for their martial traditions and colorful festivals like Tuluni.
The district headquarters is Zunheboto town.
The Sumi Baptist Church in Zunheboto is one of the largest church buildings in Asia.
The region is known for its rolling hills and picturesque landscapes.

Peren.title: Peren, Nagaland
info: The district is predominantly inhabited by the Zeliang and Kuki tribes.
The headquarters is at Peren town.
Known for its lush green landscapes and the beautiful Benreu village.
Ntangki National Park, a rich biodiversity hotspot, is located in this district.
The region is famous for its caves and natural rock formations.

Kiphire.title: Kiphire, Nagaland
info: Carved out of Tuensang district, it became a full-fledged district in 2004.
Home to Mount Saramati, the highest peak in Nagaland, which forms a natural border with Myanmar.
Inhabited by the Sangtam, Yimkhiung, and Sumi tribes.
The district headquarters is Kiphire town.
Fakim Wildlife Sanctuary is a notable protected area in the district.

Longleng.title: Longleng, Nagaland
info: Predominantly inhabited by the Phom Naga tribe.
The district was created from Tuensang district in 2004.
The headquarters is Longleng town.
The Phoms are known for their pottery, spinning, and bamboo work.
Monyu is the most important traditional festival of the Phom tribe.
